divs: Sighting DetailsA Lebanon, IL police officer received a call from the St. Clair County SheriffDept that a citizen had reported a UFO. Minutes later the officer spottedintense white lights approaching. As the object passed almost directly overheadat an estimated 1000-foot altitude, it pivoted without banking and so changedfrom a S to a SW course. The object was described as a black isosceles triangle (conservatively estimatedas 75 ft in length by 40 ft in width). Large, bright unwavering white lightswere near each axex, seemingly pointing down, while a small, pulsing red lightwas centered near the rear of the underside. No sound was heard.The officer followed the object in his cruiser at approximately the objectsspeed to a nearby town, then parked to observe further. As the object continuedinto the distance, he detected the rear as appearing rectangular, illuminated bywhite mixed with a multi-colored band of light. The object suddenly acceleratedto a great speed. The officer radioed the sheriff dept as to the objects direction. A momentlater, an officer from the Shiloh PD radioed that he had the object in sight.Duration of the Lebanon PD officers observation was 10 minutes.
